name: Custom Scheduled Posts Widget
author: Ciprian Turcu

sections.description: This plugin gives users the posibility to set a start and end date for each post in a custom form at the bottom of each post and then to add a widget to a sidebar that will show posts in the specified intervals accourding to the current date
sections.installation:
You either do it:

  1. The hard way:

    upload it to the plugins directory

  2. the easy way

Upload the zip to the plugins admin panel wordpress page on your wordpress site
sections.faq:
Is there a post limit?

No

How can I delete the date intervals?

You just set them to a different start or end date smaller than the current date. They will never show.
sections.changelog:
Here’s a link to WordPress and one to Markdown’s Syntax Documentation. Titles are optional, naturally.

Markdown uses email style notation for blockquotes and I’ve been told:

Asterisks for emphasis. Double it up for strong.

<?php code(); // goes in backticks ?>

short_description: Custom skeduled Posts. This widget gives you the ability to show  skeduled posts for start and end times on the widget content.
description: This plugin gives users the posibility to set a start and end date for each post in a custom form at the bottom of each post and then to add a widget to a sidebar that will show posts in the specified intervals accourding to the current date
